column4: I updated ubuntu 2.6.32.32 to 2.6.32.33 and rebooted today. Since then, the system is not booting up. It throws error & drops to BusyBox.
if you hold shift at boot, can you boot to the older kernel?
if it boots to the older version then run:   sudo update-grub
Before I could boot normally to 2.6.32.32 (recovery), I've had to do a update-grub. So essentially, I've already done update-grub.
